We are busy gearing up for another school year. Over the summer we have had some bitter-sweet moments: We have done some celebrating and we have hugged and said goodbyes. Over the course of the summer, we have said goodbye to some of our Syringa families as job opportunities have taken families away from the Wood River Valley to places where wages are higher, and the cost of living is lower! We have said goodbyes as families have relocated their children all to the same school within the valley.
As a result of these movements, we find ourselves with openings at all grade levels except 4th. As a school, we still remain invisible to many families in the valley. So, if you know of folks who are looking for a new environment for their children, please send them our way and we will introduce ourselves and let them know what is on offer as a public school of choice.

For more info visit the school website at https://syringamountainschool.org/ or call
Christi at 208) 806-2880
